Package array

Class Method

java.lang.Object
array.Method
public final class Method extends Object
Provides utility methods for working with methods via reflection.

  • Method Summary

  • Method Details

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Returns the name of the method.
      Returns:
      The name of the method.

    • getReturnType

      public Class getReturnType()
      Returns a Class object that represents the formal return type of the method.
      Returns:
      The Class object representing the return type of the method.

    • getParameterTypes

      public Class[] getParameterTypes()
      Returns an array of Class objects that represent the formal parameter types, in declaration order, of the method.
      Returns:
      An array of Class objects representing the parameter types of the method.

    • getDeclaringClass

      public Class getDeclaringClass()
      Returns the Class object representing the class or interface that declares the method.
      Returns:
      The Class object representing the declaring class of the method.

    • isAccessible

      public boolean isAccessible()
      Checks if the method is accessible.
      Returns:
      true if the method is accessible; otherwise, false.

    • setAccessible

      public void setAccessible(boolean accessible)
      Sets the accessibility of the method.
      Parameters:
      accessible - true to make the method accessible; false otherwise.

    • isAbstract

      public boolean isAbstract()
      Returns true if the method includes the abstract modifier.
      Returns:
      true if the method is abstract; otherwise, false.

    • isDefaultAccess

      public boolean isDefaultAccess()
      Returns true if the method does not include any of the private, protected, or public modifiers.
      Returns:
      true if the method has default access; otherwise, false.

    • isFinal

      public boolean isFinal()
      Returns true if the method includes the final modifier.
      Returns:
      true if the method is final; otherwise, false.

    • isPrivate

      public boolean isPrivate()
      Returns true if the method includes the private modifier.
      Returns:
      true if the method is private; otherwise, false.

    • isProtected

      public boolean isProtected()
      Returns true if the method includes the protected modifier.
      Returns:
      true if the method is protected; otherwise, false.

      public boolean isPublic()
      Returns true if the method includes the public modifier.
      Returns:
      true if the method is public; otherwise, false.

    • isNative

      public boolean isNative()
      Returns true if the method includes the native modifier.
      Returns:
      true if the method is native; otherwise, false.

    • isStatic

      public boolean isStatic()
      Returns true if the method includes the static modifier.
      Returns:
      true if the method is static; otherwise, false.

    • isVarArgs

      public boolean isVarArgs()
      Returns true if the method takes a variable number of arguments.
      Returns:
      true if the method is a varargs method; otherwise, false.

    • invoke

      public Object invoke(Object obj, Object... args) throws ReflectionException
      Invokes the underlying method on the supplied object with the supplied parameters.
      Parameters:
      obj - The object on which to invoke the method.
      args - The arguments to pass to the method.
      Returns:
      The result of invoking the method.
      Throws:
      ReflectionException - If an error occurs during method invocation.

    • isAnnotationPresent

      public boolean isAnnotationPresent(Class<? extends Annotation> annotationType)
      Checks if the method includes a specific annotation.
      Parameters:
      annotationType - The class type of the annotation to check.
      Returns:
      true if the method includes the provided annotation; otherwise, false.

    • getDeclaredAnnotations

      public Annotation[] getDeclaredAnnotations()
      Returns an array of annotations declared directly on this method.
      Returns:
      An array of Annotation objects representing annotations declared on this method. Returns an empty array if there are none. Does not include inherited annotations or parameter annotations.

    • getDeclaredAnnotation

      public Annotation getDeclaredAnnotation(Class<? extends Annotation> annotationType)
      Returns a specific annotation declared on this method if it exists.
      Parameters:
      annotationType - The class type of the annotation to retrieve.
      Returns:
      An Annotation object reflecting the provided annotation, or null if this method does not have such an annotation. This is a convenience function for cases where the caller knows the desired annotation type.
